Detailed Description

The Matrix class holds a 3x3 matrix for transforming coordinates.

Matrix does not have a constructor, so it must be explicitly initialized using either reset() - to construct an identity matrix, or one of the set..() functions (e.g. setTranslate, setRotate, etc.). 

     Matrix* matrix = new Matrix();
     float p1[] = {0, 0};
     float p2[] = {5, 5};

     matrix->setPolyToPoly(p1, 0, p2, 0, 1);

     float matrix_array[9];
     matrix->getValues(matrix_array);

bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::equals ( const Matrix &  obj) const

Returns true if obj is a Matrix and its values equal our values.

void gaia::graphics::Matrix::getValues ( base::Array< float > *  values) const

Copy 9 values from the matrix into the array.

The arrar size must be at least 9 large.

bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::invert ( Matrix *  inverse)

If this matrix can be inverted, return true and if inverse is not NULL, set inverse to be the inverse of this matrix.

If this matrix cannot be inverted, ignore inverse and return false.

bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::isIdentity ( ) const

Returns true if the matrix is identity.

This maybe faster than testing if (getType() == 0)

void gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapPoints ( const base::Array< float > &  src,
int32_t  srcIndex,
base::Array< float > *  dst,
int32_t  dstIndex,
int32_t  pointCount 
) const

Apply this matrix to the array of 2D points specified by src, and write the transformed points into the array of points specified by dst.

The two arrays represent their "points" as pairs of floats [x, y].

Parameters:
srcThe array of src points (x,y pairs)
srcIndexThe index of the first [x,y] pair of src floats
dstThe array of dst points (x,y pairs)
dstIndexThe index of the first [x,y] pair of dst floats
pointCountThe number of points (x,y pairs) to transform
void gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapPoints ( const base::Array< float > &  src,
base::Array< float > *  dst,
int32_t  pointCount 
) const

The two arrays represent their "points" as pairs of floats [x, y].

Parameters:
srcThe array of src points (x,y pairs)
dstThe array of dst points (x,y pairs)
pointCountThe number of points (x,y pairs)
void gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapPoints ( base::Array< float > *  pts,
int32_t  pointCount 
) const

Apply this matrix to the array of 2D points, and write the transformed points back into the array.

Parameters:
ptsThe array [x0, y0, x1, y1, ...] of points to transform.
pointCountThe number of points (x,y pairs)
float gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapRadius ( float  radius)

Return the mean radius of a circle after it has been mapped by this matrix.

NOTE: in perspective this value assumes the circle has its center at the origin.

bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapRect ( const RectF &  src,
RectF *  dst 
) const

Apply this matrix to the src rectangle, and write the transformed rectangle into dst.

This is accomplished by transforming the 4 corners of src, and then setting dst to the bounds of those points.

Parameters:
dstWhere the transformed rectangle is written.
srcThe original rectangle to be transformed.
Returns:
the result of calling rectStaysRect()
bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapRect ( RectF *  rect) const

Apply this matrix to the rectangle, and write the transformed rectangle back into it.

This is accomplished by transforming the 4 corners of rect, and then setting it to the bounds of those points

Parameters:
rectThe rectangle to transform.
Returns:
the result of calling rectStaysRect()
void gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapVectors ( const base::Array< float > &  src,
int32_t  srcIndex,
base::Array< float > *  dst,
int32_t  dstIndex,
int32_t  vectorCount 
) const

Apply this matrix to the array of 2D vectors specified by src, and write the transformed vectors into the array of vectors specified by dst.

The two arrays represent their "vectors" as pairs of floats [x, y].

Note: this method does not apply the translation associated with the matrix. Use mapPoints(const base::Array<float>&, int32_t, base::Array<float>*, int32_t ,int32_t) if you want the translation to be applied.

Parameters:
srcThe array of src vectors (x,y pairs)
srcIndexThe index of the first [x,y] pair of src floats
dstThe array of dst vectors (x,y pairs)
dstIndexThe index of the first [x,y] pair of dst floats
vectorCountThe number of vectors (x,y pairs) to transform
void gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapVectors ( const base::Array< float > &  src,
base::Array< float > *  dst,
int32_t  vectorCount 
) const

Apply this matrix to the array of 2D vectors specified by src, and write the transformed vectors into the array of vectors specified by dst.

The two arrays represent their "vectors" as pairs of floats [x, y].

Note: this method does not apply the translation associated with the matrix. Use Matrix#mapPoints(const base::Array<float>&, base::Array<float>*, int32_t) if you want the translation to be applied.

Parameters:
srcThe array of src vectors (x,y pairs)
dstThe array of dst vectors (x,y pairs)
vectorCountThe number of vectors (x,y pairs)
void gaia::graphics::Matrix::mapVectors ( base::Array< float > *  vecs,
int32_t  vectorCount 
) const

Apply this matrix to the array of 2D vectors, and write the transformed vectors back into the array.

Note: this method does not apply the translation associated with the matrix. Use Matrix#mapPoints(base::Array<float>*, int32_t) if you want the translation to be applied.

Parameters:
vecsThe array [x0, y0, x1, y1, ...] of vectors to transform.
vectorCountThe number of vectors (x,y pairs)

Postconcats the matrix with the specified matrix.

M' = other * M

bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::rectStaysRect ( ) const

Returns true if will map a rectangle to another rectangle.

This can be true if the matrix is identity, scale-only, or rotates a multiple of 90 degrees.

void gaia::graphics::Matrix::reset ( )

Set the matrix to identity.

void gaia::graphics::Matrix::set ( const Matrix &  src)

(deep) copy the src matrix into this matrix.

bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::setConcat ( const Matrix &  a,
const Matrix &  b 
)

Set the matrix to the concatenation of the two specified matrices, returning true if the the result can be represented.

Either of the two matrices may also be the target matrix. this = a * b

bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::setPolyToPoly ( const base::Array< float > &  src,
int32_t  srcIndex,
const base::Array< float > &  dst,
int32_t  dstIndex,
int32_t  pointCount 
)

Set the matrix such that the specified src points would map to the specified dst points.

The "points" are represented as an array of floats, order [x0, y0, x1, y1, ...], where each "point" is 2 float values.

Parameters:
srcThe array of src [x,y] pairs (points)
srcIndexIndex of the first pair of src values
dstThe array of dst [x,y] pairs (points)
dstIndexIndex of the first pair of dst values
pointCountThe number of pairs/points to be used. Must be [0..4]
Returns:
true if the matrix was set to the specified transformation
bool gaia::graphics::Matrix::setRectToRect ( const RectF &  src,
const RectF &  dst,
int32_t  stf 
)

Set the matrix to the scale and translate values that map the source rectangle to the destination rectangle, returning true if the the result can be represented.

Parameters:
srcthe source rectangle to map from.
dstthe destination rectangle to map to.
stfthe ScaleToFit option
Returns:
true if the matrix can be represented by the rectangle mapping.
void gaia::graphics::Matrix::setRotate ( float  degrees,
float  px,
float  py 
)

Set the matrix to rotate by the specified number of degrees, with a pivot point at (px, py).

The pivot point is the coordinate that should remain unchanged by the specified transformation.

Set the matrix to rotate about (0,0) by the specified number of degrees.

void gaia::graphics::Matrix::setValues ( const base::Array< float > &  values)

Copy 9 values from the array into the matrix.

Depending on the implementation of Matrix, these may be transformed into 16.16 integers in the Matrix, such that a subsequent call to getValues() will not yield exactly the same values. The arrar size must be at least 9 large.
